page.title: 11HILL FARMING (DAIRY)
page.content: The Friesian Holstein is the best cow for milking in this area. It can be red and white as well as the better known black and white. The Friesian was brought from Holland in the 18th Century because of a cattle plague in Britain. These days the cows are milked twice a day. A tanker comes in the morning, but not in the evening. Most of the milk is taken to Hawes Dairy (four miles away) where it is made into butter and cheese, but some is distributed locally. No milking is done by hand unless a cow's tit is bad. The cattle are wintered in the byres and put out to the pastures in mid-Spring according to the weather. Hay and silage are made locally, but much has to be brought in. The 1984 EEC milk quota has resulted in smaller herds and more meat production.
